title: I really just want to give Krezia Rodhe a hug
body:
Man Riot, you have really outdone yourselves. Brand/Kegan Rodhe's Backstory is really sad and deals with a lot of adult themes. I feel sorry for both of them and the allusion of being the Son of a Healer and a Raider is just a thin veil for what really happened. Rape! Not just rape, but victim blaming as well on top of the superstition of women with magical power. Just seeing someone like her crying a lot and not being mentally able to raise her son properly alongside the ostracization of the villager is just sad, man. 

WIthout a doubt, From the Ashes is the most hardcore, realistic and grim story ever.

And as for Kegan, I don't blame him for doing what he did, hell on some level he is justified in burning his village to the ground. Instead of pity, his family got scorned, instead of sympathy, they got antipathy, instead of mercy, cruelty.

It's amazing that Krezia didn't go insane after what happened and still raised her son after what happened. To still do your duty and have kindness after all of **THAT** is strength of character. And I hope in the future that She becomes a champion, a spirit of healing of some sorts.

replies.body: I doubt will ever see her as a champion. At the very least I want to see some artwork of her as well as full image of Kegan.
I think we can finally answer the question of why Brand wears pants, too.
It's because he wants to show that he's an earnest man who never lies, isn't it?

That's really great to hear - glad you enjoyed it! Aaron's Twitter and Facebook have apparently blown up with praise, too :-) Not a bad debut all round!

If you'd like to see more from him, and from Kegan and Ryze, please do email Riot directly as well!

1) Who exactly should we email and what should we say?

2) Why is Brand missing from the From the Ashes content on the map.

3) Young Brand skin when?
oh yes that skin please. i would buy it even though i dont play brand, the story was that good.
